'''Needlehole''' was a town in the [[Westfarthing]] near the border of the [[Northfarthing]] in [[the Shire]]. [[The Water]] flowed through the town on its way south to [[Rushock Bog]].<ref>{{FR|Part}}</ref>

==Etymology==
Needlehole is also the name of a village in [[Wikipedia:Gloucestershire|Gloucestershire]]. Apart from the apparent meaning of the name, it might also refer to [[hobbit-holes]].<ref>{{HM|RC}}, lviii</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Needlehole.jpg|thumb|left|Needlehole in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Needlehole lies directly to the north of the [[Rushock Bog]]. Its hobbit inhabitants are the ones most used to seeing dwarves in the Shire, as Needlehole lies directly on the road leadin to [[Thorin's Halls]] in [[Ered Luin]].
